CodeList.Name: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 Questionnaire Test Name

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury use of alcoholic beverages.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury use of alcoholic beverages.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Tense, nervous, fearful, phobias, nightmares, flashbacks of stressful events.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems ignoring distractions, shifting attention, keeping more than one thing in mind at a time.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems hearing; ringing in the ears.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Sad, blue, hopeless, poor appetite, poor sleep, worry, self-criticism.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Feeling unsteady, dizzy, light-headed.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury use of illegal drugs or abuse of prescription drugs.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury use of illegal drugs or abuse of prescription drugs.

Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Interactions with close others; describe stress within the family or those closest to the person with brain injury; 'family functioning' means cooperating to accomplish those tasks that need to be done to keep the household running.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Adjustment: Family or Significant Relationships

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Feeling tired; lack of energy; tiring easily.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems remembering information learned in school or on the job; difficulty remembering information about self and family from years ago.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Lack of recognition of personal limitations and disabilities and how they interfere with everyday activities and work or school.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Acting childish, silly, rude, behavior not fitting for time and place.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems getting started on activities without prompting.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Verbal or physical expressions of anger.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury history before and after injury.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury history before and after injury.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Leisure and recreational activities.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Participation: Leisure and Recreational Activities

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Shopping, keeping a check book or other bank account, managing personal income and investments.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Participation: Managing Money and Finances

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems learning and recalling new information.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems walking or moving; balance problems that interfere with moving about.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Abnormal clearness or rate of speech; stuttering.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Restricted or unusual gestures or facial expressions; talking too much or not enough; missing nonverbal cues from others.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems thinking up solutions or picking the best solution to new problems.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury cognitive disability due to nonpsychiatric medical conditions other than brain injury, such as, dementia, stroke, developmental disability.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Other Condition Causing Cognitive Impairment Post-Injury

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury cognitive disability due to nonpsychiatric medical conditions other than brain injury, such as, dementia, stroke, developmental disability.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Other Condition Causing Cognitive Impairment Pre-Injury

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Hours per week involved in constructive, role-appropriate activity other than paid employment when primary desired social role is not paid employment. 'Support' means special help from another person with responsibilities (such as, a job coach or shadow, tutor, helper) or reduced responsibilities. Modifications to the physical environment that facilitate employment are not considered as support.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Primary social role when paid employment is not primary desired social role.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury physical disability due to medical conditions other than brain injury, such as, spinal cord injury, amputation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Other Condition Causing Physical Impairment Post-Injury

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury physical disability due to medical conditions other than brain injury, such as, spinal cord injury, amputation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Other Condition Causing Physical Impairment Pre-Injury

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Hours per week at paid employment when primary desired social role is paid employment. 'Support' means special help from another person with responsibilities (such as, a job coach or shadow, tutor, helper) or reduced responsibilities. Modifications to the physical environment that facilitate employment are not considered as support.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Verbal and nonverbal expressions of pain; activities limited by pain.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Post-injury hallucinations, delusions, other persistent severely distorted perceptions of reality.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Pre-injury hallucinations, delusions, other persistent severely distorted perceptions of reality.

Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Responsibilities of independent living and homemaking (such as meal preparation, home repairs and maintenance, personal health maintenance beyond basic hygiene including medication management) but not including managing money.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Eating, dressing, bathing, hygiene.

Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Focusing on thinking, physical or emotional problems attributed to brain injury; rate only how concern or worry about these symptoms affects current functioning over and above the effects of the symptoms themselves.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Adjustment: Sensitivity to Mild Symptoms

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Social contact with friends, work associates, and other people who are not family, significant others, or professionals.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: MPAI-4 - Participation: Social Contact with Fiends, Work Associates and Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Transportation.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Impaired strength or coordination in one or both hands.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems expressing or understanding language.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems seeing; double vision; eye, brain, or nerve injuries that interfere with seeing.
Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 - Problems drawing, assembling things, route-finding, being visually aware on both the left and right sides.

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Mayo-Portland Adaptability Inventory-4 Questionnaire Test Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire MPAI-4 Test Name Terminology
